meanings.definition: To make a light, sharp, metallic sound
meanings.sent1: I heard the spoon plink against the glass.
meanings.sent2: The raindrops plinked on the roof all night.
meanings.sent3: The tiny pebbles plinked against the window, creating a musical rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to plink through the room, bringing joy to all.
meanings.sent5: The wind chimes plinked softly in the breeze, creating a soothing melody.

meanings.sent1: The plink of the coins hitting the floor echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: The plink of the metal bell signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plink of the falling pin caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The plink of the distant train whistle filled the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The plink of the hammer hitting the nail was music to his ears.
